intro: Beilschmiedia costaricensis, commonly known as the Costa Rican beilschmiedia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central America. It belongs to the family Lauraceae, which includes laurels, and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and simple, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by elliptical, dark purple to black berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
